comments: Turner (IND) jumps from point A to point B into Rozier (CHA) and the body contact impacts his layup attempt at the basket.
Turner (IND) establishes himself in Martin's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs as Martin fights over the pick.
Ball (CHA) brings his arms to the ball during Haliburton's (IND) gather and Ball is able to dislodge it from Haliburton. The arm contact after the dislodge is considered incidental.
Ball (CHA) makes last contact with the ball prior to it bouncing out of bounds. Possession is properly retained by Indiana.
Hield (IND) establishes himself in Plumlee's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs as the two players come together during the screen.
Rozier (CHA) legally contests Hield's (IND) turnaround jump shot attempt.
Nembhard (IND) realigns along Ball's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs as the pick is set.
Plumlee (CHA) establishes himself in Nembhard's (IND) path and marginal contact occurs as Nembhard fights over the pick.
Nesmith (IND) jumps alongside Ball's (CHA) path as he leaves his feet and successfully releases his pass through the marginal contact.
Turner (IND) is firming up on his left leg, when Martin (CHA) fights over the pick and marginal contact occurs.
Plumlee (CHA) extends his left arm into Turner's (IND) chest and the contact in the air alters Turner's layup attempt at the basket.
Nembhard (IND) briefly places and immediately retracts his hand from Ball's (CHA) front during the drive. The contact on the play is marginal.
Ball (CHA) places and removes his off-hand from Nembhard's (IND) right arm and the contact during the drive is marginal.
Washington (CHA) gathers the ball on his left foot and takes two legal steps before releasing his pass.
Hield (IND) gets to ball height and cleanly blocks Ball's (CHA) perimeter jump shot attempt.
After the block, Ball (CHA) extends his arms and legs out and initiates contact with Hield (IND) that impacts his opportunity to secure the loose ball.
Rozier (CHA) receives the pass and proceeds to drop the ball and regather it. Rozier does not dribble after regathering the ball and is legally allowed to recover it.
Nembhard (IND) momentarily holds his right arm out as the screen is set and Rozier (CHA) raises his arm to draw attention to the marginal contact.
Turner (IND) steps toward his left as Rozier (CHA) dribbles towards the basket and marginal lower body contact occurs that Rozier is able to play on through.
Haliburton (IND) brings his left hand around Rozier (CHA) and makes direct contact with the ball that dislodges it away from Rozier during his gather.
Nesmith (IND) releases the ball prior to his right foot coming down out of bounds.
At the start of the drive, Haliburton (IND) brings his left arm out slightly and marginal contact occurs with Washington (CHA).
Plumlee (CHA) reaches in for the ball and initiates arm contact with Haliburton (IND) that affects his SQBR during his dribble in transition.
Washington (CHA) firms up on his right leg and marginal contact occurs as Haliburton (IND) fights over the screen.
Haliburton (IND) and Smith Jr. (CHA) come together during the drive and marginal contact occurs that Smith Jr. is able to play on through.
Haliburton (IND) retreats his arms into a vertical position as he absorbs the marginal contact with Smith Jr. (CHA), who jumps out from under the basket during his layup attempt.
Washington (CHA) commits a take foul on Nesmith (IND). The transition take foul rule does not apply to the last two minutes of either the fourth quarter or overtime.
Plumlee (CHA) establishes himself in Nembhard's (IND) path and marginal contact occurs as Nembhard goes over the pick.
Turner (IND) gets to ball height and makes hand-on-ball contact with Plumlee (CHA), which blocks his shot attempt at the basket.
Smith Jr. (CHA) commits a take foul on Haliburton (IND). The transition take foul rule does not apply to the last two minutes of either the fourth quarter or overtime.
Hield (IND) legally contests Washington's (CHA) attempt at the basket.
Smith Jr. (CHA) commits a take foul on Nesmith (IND). The transition take foul rule does not apply to the last two minutes of either the fourth quarter or overtime.
Nembhard (IND) legally contests Rozier's (CHA) perimeter jump shot attempt.
